# Courses  

```{python}

import pandas as pd

# Create DataFrame
courses = {
    "Course Name": [
        "Cloud Analytics for Business",
        "Project Management",
        "Financial Concepts",
        "Enterprise Risk Management",
        "Quantitative and Qualitative Decision Making",
        "Business Analytics Foundations"
    ],
    "Course Status": [
        "Current",
        "Completed",
        "Completed",
        "Completed",
        "Completed",
        "Completed"
    ]
}

df = pd.DataFrame(courses)

# Use Styler to center headers and cells, hide index
styled_df = df.style.set_table_styles(
    [
        {'selector': 'th', 'props': [
            ('text-align', 'center'), 
            ('background-color', '#A0C1E8'),  # lighter navy blue
            ('color', 'black'), 
            ('font-weight', 'bold'), 
            ('padding', '8px')
        ]},
        {'selector': 'td', 'props': [
            ('text-align', 'center'), 
            ('color', 'black'), 
            ('padding', '6px')
        ]}
    ]
).hide(axis="index")  # hides the 0-5 index column

# Display table in Quarto
styled_df
